alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 11:34PM EDT until June 26 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill and Powell. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson, Lee, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Irvine, Beattyville, Booneville, Fincastle, Ravenna, Evelyn, Pinnacle, Willow Shoals, Shade, Leighton, Old Landing, Texola, Crystal, Yellow Rock, Pryse, Whynot, Heidelberg, Alumbaugh, Caryton and Cressmont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
